title: Chinese Classics & Philosophy: Confucius, I Ching & Zen
description: The foundational texts of Chinese philosophy: the I Ching divination classic, Confucian Four Books, and D.T. Suzuki's introduction of Zen Buddhism to the West.

books.title: I Ching - Sacred Books of China (Legge)
books.author: James Legge

books.title: Total I Ching - Myths for Change
books.author: Stephen Karcher

keyTexts: I Ching: Ancient divination text, Book of Changes, cosmology and wisdom
Four Books: Analects, Great Learning, Doctrine of the Mean, Mencius - Confucian canon
Confucius Sinarum Philosophus: 1687 Jesuit Latin translation that introduced Confucius to Europe
D.T. Suzuki: Foundational works introducing Zen Buddhism to Western audiences
researchValue: Essential for understanding Chinese philosophy and its transmission to the West. The 1687 Latin Confucius influenced European Enlightenment. Wilhelm's I Ching (with Jung's foreword) shaped Western understanding. Suzuki's Zen writings sparked Beat Generation and 1960s interest in Buddhism.
